page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area surveyed by the Shrewton School members is situated approximately twelve miles north-west of the city of Salisbury, on Salisbury Plain.The area includes the southern part of Shrewton and a small part of Winterbourne Stoke. The rural,gently undulating, landscape is indicative of the area. The predominant land-cover is farmland, the majority of which is enclosed rough grazing and cultivated fields.The River Till flows through Shrewton giving rise to water meadows near Rollestone and a scenic riverside walk along the Lower Backway to Bourton Bridge.Other interesting features include Parsonage Down which is a National Nature Reserve, and the Blindhouse, a temporary lock-up for sheep thieves and petty criminals.
